description: '''West Coast jazz''' refers to styles of [[jazz]] that developed in Los Angeles and San Francisco during the 1950s. West Coast jazz is often seen as a subgenre of [[cool jazz]], which consisted of a calmer style than [[bebop]] or [[hard bop]]. The music relied relatively more on composition and [[arrangement (music)|arrangement]] than on the individually improvised playing of other jazz styles. Although this style dominated, it was not the only form of jazz heard on the American West Coast.
